div.h1:
Fallsburg Central School District
Fallsburg Central School District is a safe, nurturing environment, where excellence is expected, diversity and individuality are celebrated, and learning prepares students to face the challenges of an ever-changing global society

div.style: position: absolute; left: 0px; top: 0px; z-index: 100001; background-color: rgb(170, 170, 170); opacity: 0.5; display: none;

div.p: The Fallsburg Central School District would like to welcome you to our website! Feel free to explore our web space! Subscribe to our Facebook or Twitter feeds to receive updates on school and district information!

h2.style: font-size: 26px; font-family: lusitanaregular; font-weight: bold; margin: 0px 0px 15px; color: rgb(20, 31, 62); padding: 5px; border-top: 8px solid rgb(0, 0, 0); border-bottom: 1px solid rgb(0, 0, 0);

span.span: Fallsburg staff will be updating assignments for students online (in Google Classroom or Class Dojo) and sending packets home via Rolling V bus runs. For more information, please go to

span.style: font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; color: rgb(34, 34, 34);
span.span:
.
Los maestros de Fallsburg estarán otorgando asignaturas/tareas para los estudiantes en Internet (en Google Classroom o Class Dojo) y enviaran paquetes a algunos domicilios a través de corridas de los autobuses de Rolling V. Para más información, favor de ingresar a http://t.ly/lqq0R

a.title: Athletics link opens in new window
Letter from the JSHS Principal: April 28, 2020

div.a: Letter from the JSHS Principal: April 28, 2020
div.div: Please read the letter below. Por favor lea la carta a continuación.
div.a: Read More About Letter from the JSHS Principal: April 28, 2020
Emergency Child Care Plans
div.div: By Executive Order, the public school districts of Sullivan County have developed emergency child care plans for essential workers. Por orden ejecutiva, los distritos escolares públicos del condado de Sullivan han desarrollado planes de cuidado infantil de emergencia para trabajadores esenciales.
div.a: Read More About Emergency Child Care Plans

a.title: Curricula and Grading Changes Online Town Hall Meetings

div.a: Curricula and Grading Changes Online Town Hall Meetings
div.div: You are Invited!!! Curricula and Grading Changes Online Town Hall Meetings: ¡¡Está cordialmente invitado!! En Español: Reunión del ayuntamiento en línea para discutir Cambios al Currículum y método de Calificación:
div.a: Read More About Curricula and Grading Changes Online Town Hall Meetings
Grading Changes During the Closure
div.div: Emergency changes have been adopted by the District regarding grading practices. El Distrito ha adoptado cambios de emergencia con respecto a las prácticas de calificación.
div.a: Read More About Grading Changes During the Closure
Special BoE Meeting: April 28
div.div: PLEASE TAKE NOTICE that a Special meeting of the Board of Education of the Fallsburg Central School District, Sullivan and Ulster Counties, New York, will be held on April 28, 2020 via teleconference beginning at 10:00 AM
div.a: Read More About Special BoE Meeting: April 28

a.title: 2020-2021 Pre-K and Kindergarten Registration / 2020-2021 Registración de Prekinder y Kinder

div.a: 2020-2021 Pre-K and Kindergarten Registration / 2020-2021 Registración de Prekinder y Kinder
div.div: Kindergarten and Pre-K Registration will take place from April 27 through May 22. Las registraciones para Kinder y Prekinder tendrán lugar del 27 de abril al 22 de mayo.
div.a: Read More About 2020-2021 Pre-K and Kindergarten Registration / 2020-2021 Registración de Prekinder y Kinder
Message from the Superintendent: April 17, 2020
div.div: School Closure Period Extended Through May 15, 2020. Período de cierre de la escuela se a extendido hasta el 15 de mayo de 2020.
div.a: Read More About Message from the Superintendent: April 17, 2020

a.title: An Important Message from Public Health Services

div.a: An Important Message from Public Health Services
div.div: This afternoon, an emergency order was issued by County Manager Joshua Potosek and approved by the NYS Department of Health, to assist the Department of Public Health Services with reinforcing the importance of Isolation & Quarantine orders to help reduce community transmission of COVID-19.
div.a: Read More About An Important Message from Public Health Services

a.title: Letter from Interim New York State Education Commissioner: April 10. 2020

div.a: Letter from Interim New York State Education Commissioner: April 10. 2020
div.div: The COVID-19 pandemic is having a profound effect on all of our lives and is challenging us in unprecedented ways. La pandemia de COVID-19 está teniendo un profundo efecto en todas nuestras vidas y nos está desafiando de maneras sin precedentes.
div.a: Read More About Letter from Interim New York State Education Commissioner: April 10. 2020

img.alt: Logo for NY State of Health

a.title: New York State of Health Letter

div.a: New York State of Health Letter
div.div: As we work through these challenging times together, NY State of Health is committed to ensuring access to affordable, quality health insurance for all New Yorkers so they can get the care they need during this state of emergency.
div.a: Read More About New York State of Health Letter
Letter from the Superintendent: April 6, 2020
div.div: I just wanted to share updates on the Governor's extension of our school closure and the cancellation of Regents exams for June. Solo quería compartir actualizaciones sobre la extensión del gobernador del cierre de nuestra escuela y la cancelación de los exámenes Regents para junio.
div.a: Read More About Letter from the Superintendent: April 6, 2020
Legal Notice: April 3, 2020
div.div: Notice is hereby given that the annual Meeting and Budget Vote typically held each year on the third Tuesday in May is hereby postponed until at least June 1, 2020, and the circulation, filing, and collection of petitions for Board of Education positions are postponed pursuant to the New York State Governor’s Executive Order 202.13. Further notice will be given when more information is available.
div.a: Read More About Legal Notice: April 3, 2020
Letter from the Superintendent: April 3, 2020
div.div: I would like to take a moment to thank you for your patience and understanding as the district has worked at a number of levels to serve our students and families at this most challenging time. It hasn’t been easy for you and it’s been an unprecedented challenge for the school district. Me gustaría tomar un momento para agradecerles por su paciencia y comprensión, ya que el distrito ha trabajado en varios niveles para servir a nuestros estudiantes y familias en este momento tan difícil. No ha sido fácil para usted y ha sido un desafío sin precedentes para el distrito escolar.
div.a: Read More About Letter from the Superintendent: April 3, 2020

a.title: Letter from the Director of Pupil Personnel Services: April 3, 2020

div.a: Letter from the Director of Pupil Personnel Services: April 3, 2020
div.div: I hope this message finds you and your families healthy and in good spirits. I am hopeful that this message will address some of your questions and concerns at this unpredictable and uncertain time. Furthermore, I hope that the answers will provide some clarity and reassurance that we are going to do everything in our power to support your children and our students at this unprecedented time. Please read this message in its entirety. If, after reading this message, you have lingering questions, please do not hesitate to contact either myself or Assistant Director of Pupil Personnel Services, Michele McCoy. Our contact information is listed below the contents of this message. Espero que este mensaje los encuentre a usted y a sus familias saludables y de buen humor. Espero que este mensaje aborde algunas de sus preguntas e inquietudes en este momento impredecible e incierto. Además, espero que las respuestas proporcionen algo de claridad y tranquilidad de que haremos todo lo que esté a nuestro alcance para apoyar a sus hijos y a nuestros estudiantes en este momento sin precedentes. Por favor lea este mensaje en su totalidad. Si, después de leer este mensaje, tiene preguntas persistentes, por favor no dude en contactarse conmigo mismo o al Subdirector de Servicios al Personal del Alumno, Michele McCoy. Nuestra información de contacto se encuentra debajo del contenido de este mensaje.
div.a: Read More About Letter from the Director of Pupil Personnel Services: April 3, 2020
Employee Rights
div.div: The Families First Coronavirus Response Act (FFCRA or Act) requires certain employers to provide their employees with paid sick leave and expanded family and medical leave for specified reasons related to COVID-19. These provisions will apply from April 1, 2020 through December 31, 2020. La Ley Familias Primero de Respuesta al Coronavirus (FFCRA o Ley) requiere que ciertos empleadores den a empleados licencias laboral pagadas o expansión de licencia familiar y por enfermedad por razones relativas al COVID-19. Estas provisiones aplicarán desde abril 1 hasta diciembre 31 del 2020.
div.a: Read More About Employee Rights
Letter from the Superintendent: March 20, 2020
div.div: The State of New York, in an effort to support the critical work of healthcare workers and first responders, has required school districts to establish child care services for them. El Estado de Nueva York, en un esfuerzo por apoyar el trabajo crítico de los trabajadores de atención médica y los socorristas, ha requerido que los distritos escolares establezcan servicios de cuidado infantil para estos trabajadores.
div.a: Read More About Letter from the Superintendent: March 20, 2020

a.title: Board Petitions are Available for Download

div.a: Board Petitions are Available for Download
div.div: Candidates must obtain the signatures from 25 qualified voters of the Fallsburg Central School District for the seat they wish to run for. I encourage candidates to gather more than 25 signatures in the event a signer is disqualified from the petition upon verification. Petitions must be returned to the office of the District Clerk no later than 5:00 PM on Monday, April 20, 2020.
div.a: Read More About Board Petitions are Available for Download
Letter from the Superintendent: March 13, 2020
div.div: The purpose of this letter is to update you on COVID-19 issues as they relate to the Fallsburg Central School District. El propósito de esta carta es informarle sobre los problemas de COVID-19 en relación con el Distrito Escolar Central de Fallsburg.
div.a: Read More About Letter from the Superintendent: March 13, 2020

img.alt: Picture of Sullivan County Census Logo

div.a: Everyone Counts! Census 2020! ¡Todos Contamos!
div.div: The Fallsburg Central School District invites you to use our facilities and our technology to complete the census per the schedule. El Distrito Escolar Central de Fallsburg lo invita a usar nuestras instalaciones y a usar nuestra tecnología para completar el censo según los siguientes horarios.
div.a: Read More About Everyone Counts! Census 2020! ¡Todos Contamos!

img.alt: Image of part of the flyer

div.a: Family Support Group
div.div: FREE education and support group for those with a loved one struggling with addiction.
div.a: Read More About Family Support Group

a.title: Are you interested in becoming a bus driver?

div.a: Are you interested in becoming a bus driver?
div.div: Rolling V is hiring and training for the next school year. Get on the path to earning your permit followed by professional prep for the road test and achieve your CDL license! While learning the skills to advance, you will right from the start have a paying job as a bus monitor. Transport great kids to school or to activities near and far. Explore the opportunities by responding to: info@rollingv.com or call 845-292-1393.
div.a: Read More About Are you interested in becoming a bus driver?
JSHS Grading Changes 19-20
div.div: The Fallsburg Jr.-Sr. High School is making several improvements to student grading and reporting for 2019–20. These changes have been developed after extensive discussions among the school’s grading practices committee, and in full consideration of research, literature, and feedback on grading practices.
div.a: Read More About JSHS Grading Changes 19-20
School Vaccination Requirements
div.div: Information on A Statement on Legislation Removing Non-Medical Exemption from School Vaccination Requirements and Information on Vaccinations at HRHCare in Monticello.
div.a: Read More About School Vaccination Requirements
